comments.body: hack/update-swagger-spec should call this as well, right?
We need to first run update docs and then run update spec. Where should I put that dependency? I already edit the order on pre-commit. Isn't it enough?

Is my following understanding correct: If someone has edited the types.go and forgets to run update docs, then pre-commit will tell him to run update docs; after he runs update docs, pre-commit will fail again and indicates he needs to run update spec.

If my understanding is correct, is it possible to embed update doc & verify doc into update spec & verify spec, so that a user only needs to verify & update once?

If someone updates `types.go` then for sure we must update swagger specs. So I agree we might want to append swagger spec update after swagger doc update.

On the other hand we need swagger spec update as a separate script as there are also other reasons that the spec might change. (e.g. alter tags, change go-restful, etc..)

So I will add a call to update specs inside update docs.
